question: Which of the following types of soils is indicated by the portion marked with ‘A’?
explanation: Alluvial is loose, unconsolidated soil or sediment that has been eroded, reshaped by water in some form, and redeposited in a non-marine setting. Alluvium is typically made up of a variety of materials, including fine particles of silt and clay and larger particles of sand and gravel. It is indicated by the potion marked with ‘A’.
